page.title: 09Housing In Mayfield.
page.content: Mayfield has many very old houses,some half_timbered and dating back to the 15th century.There are only three very small blocks of purpose_built flats, 2 especially for the elderly.Some of the largest houses have been divided into flats.Mayfield has a small Council Estate but a lot of the houses are now being bought by the residents.The village has quite a number of bungalows and nearly all homes have a garden,often very large.The outskirts of the village has many farmhouses and farmworkers' cottages.Some,including some oast houses have been converted into private homes and therefore extensively modernised.Mayfield has very few new house.A few have been built along the site of the old railway line and a few more behind the village.
